article.title: Running and Debugging a Single Test From Android Studio

introduction.paragraph: These instructions work with either your own application unit tests or the Couchbase lite library code. However, in the case of the latter, you need to depend on the Couchbase Lite code directly rather than using Maven artifacts.

list-item.paragraph: Click the Plus (+) button and choose Android Tests, and give it a name (for example, MyTest).
In the module pulldown menu, choose the module in which your test lives.

The following figure shows selecting a test in the cblite library.
In the "Test" section, choose the Class radio button.
Under class, add the fully qualified class name that you want to test. For example, com.couchbase.cblite.testapp.tests.Router.
Click Apply or OK
Make sure MyTest is chosen in the configuration pulldown, and choose Run / Debug.
Wait until it reaches your breakpoint.
